verbose_text: Cell cycle arrest caused by several anticancer agents is an essential mechanism in the growth inhibition of cancer cells [XREF_BIBR] and our present results show that 8-deoxylactucin caused the arrest of the RB355 retinoblastoma cells at the G2/M checkpoint, which was associated with suppression of cyclin A and cyclin B. Previous studies have also shown that suppression of cyclins, especially cyclin A and B, triggers cell cycle arrest [XREF_BIBR].
evidence: cyclins, especially cyclin A and B, triggers cell cycle
